title: BOC Report Summary permissions
custom_expected:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* A new LDAP is created for the BOC Report Summary viewer role.
* A new LDAP is created for the BOC Report Summary editor role.
* Users without either LDAP are not able to open Report summaries. 
* Users without the edit LDAP are unable to edit or make any changes to report summaries. 
* The LDAP is added to the wiki.

title: As a BOC user I want to save changes to a Report Summary
custom_expected:
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing a Report Summary in edit mode there is a Save button as well as a Cancel button. 
* Clicking '"Save" will save all changes made to the report, including added and removed players as well as any changes made to the individual players' report summaries. 
* Changes made to the individual players' report summaries are NOT saved in the system if the overall form is not saved after the edits are made. 
* If the report has never been saved before, then the system will update the status of the report to "Draft". 
* If the report status is already in a Published status, then the system will run a required field and format check, including verifying that all of the MLB players included in the report are completed. 
* If the user clicks "Cancel" then the user will be prompted to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.
* If the user confirms, the screen will reload in view mode and none of the edits will be maintained.

title: As a BOC user I want to edit a Report Summary
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=report_summary_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Player+Report+Modals+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing a Report Summary in any state, there is an Edit button.
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the Report Summary in edit mode per the provided data discovery and wireframe. 
* For any MLB Players contained in the Report Summary, there is an "Edit Report" button available in edit mode. 
* Clicking "Edit Report" will open the modal. The appropriate fields display depending on which position is selected (see wires and data discovery). 
* Clicking "Cancel" on the modal will cancel any edits made, close the modal and return the user to the Report Summary in edit mode. 
* The user has the ability to complete the modal and click "OK". 
* Clicking "OK" stores the edits made, closes the modal and returns the user to the Report Summary in edit mode. 
* Users are able to remove players from the Report in edit mode by using the trash can icon. 
* Users are able to add a player to the Report in edit mode by using the "Add Player" button.
* Clicking "Add Player" adds a row to the report summary, with the user able to pick a MLB Player (population of players is anyone currently on any MLB Org's MJ or MN Roster). 
* Once a player is selected, the Player field disables, the MLB Org populates and the "Edit Report" button becomes available for the player.

title: As a BOC user I want to view the Box Score for a position player
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=pos___catcher
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=player_report_modal

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Player+Report+Modals+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* For players that have detailed stats available from BAM for the game the "Box Score" column will be populated with a checkbox. 
* When clicking on "View Report" for any position player (including catchers) that has a Box Score available, the report modal will include a section with the Box Score and the corresponding stats. 
* The Box Score portion of the modal will match the provided data discovery and wireframes. 
* The stats provided will match those that can be found for the player and game at mlb.com.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to Generate the Performance Report from the Club Communication widget
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=club_comm_widget_-_boc

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing the Club Communication widget there is a "Generate Report" button. 
* Clicking the Generate Report button will launch the Business Objects prompt for the Winter League Performance Report. 
* The user should be able to use Business Objects to run the report according to their desired parameters.

title: As a BOC user I want to Publish a Report Summary

Data Discovery:

* Clicking "Publish to Clubs" will update the Report Summary's status to Published.

title: As a BOC user I want to see an error if I attempt to publish a Report Summary with players incomplete
custom_expected:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking Publish to Clubs will check that there are no MLB players currently in the report that do not yet have the required fields completed in their individual summary. 
* If one or more players is found to be incomplete, a hard error is displayed. See Messages # 15.

title: As a BOC user I want to Re-Open a Report Summary

* Clicking "Reopen" will update the Report Summary's status to Draft.

title: As a BOC user I want to Delete a Report Summary
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=report_summary_-_boc

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user is viewing a Report Summary in any status, there is a "Delete" button displayed in view or edit mode. 
* Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the report summary. See Messages #16. 
* If the user confirms, the system deletes the report summary and it is no longer visible to the BOC, Winter League Clubs or in the Performance Report, regardless of if it was published prior to deletion.   The user will be redirected back to the Club Comms widget and a blue notification will be thrown "Successfully deleted"

title: As BOC I want to generate the WLP performance report from widget
As a user I want a new report summary to be automatically created for any team that has a game
custom_expected:
Acceptance Criteria:
* When stats are found for any Winter League team, a new Report Summary is automatically created for the team.
* The Report Summary has a status of "Pending" and includes by default a list of all of the players included on the team's roster, regardless of if they are a MLB player or not. 
* The position for MLB players should default based on their Stats position. 
* This report summary should be available in the BOC's Club Communication widget.
* This report summary should be available in the relevant Club's Club Communication widget. 
* After initial creation the roster contained on the report summary should NOT update, even if adjustments are made in BAM.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to edit a Report Summary
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=report_summary_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Player+Report+Modals+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user is viewing a Report Summary in a Pending or Draft state, there is an Edit button.
* No edit button appears in the Closed or Published state. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the Report Summary in edit mode per the provided data discovery and wireframe. 
* For any MLB Players contained in the Report Summary, there is an "Edit Report" button available in edit mode. 
* Clicking "Edit Report" will open the modal. The appropriate fields display depending on which position is selected (see wires and data discovery). 
* Clicking "Cancel" on the modal will cancel any edits made, close the modal and return the user to the Report Summary in edit mode. 
* The user has the ability to complete the modal and click "OK". 
* Clicking "OK" stores the edits made, closes the modal and returns the user to the Report Summary in edit mode. These are not officially saved until the user clicks "Save" on the main form as per #157301091.
* Users are able to remove players from the Report in edit mode by using the trash can icon. 
* Users are able to add a player to the Report in edit mode by using the "Add Player" button.
* Clicking "Add Player" adds a row to the report summary, with the user able to pick a MLB Player (population of players is anyone currently on any MLB Org's MJ or MN Roster). 
* Once a player is selected, the Player field disables, the MLB Org populates and the "Edit Report" button becomes available for the player.

custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=pos___dnp

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Player+Report+Modals+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria:

* Clicking on "Ver Informe" will launch a modal in view mode in Spanish per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 

*Note that Box Score will be handled in a separate story*

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to edit a Report Summary in Spanish
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=report_summary_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Player+Report+Modals+-+Data+Discovery
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Necessary+Spanish+Translations


Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user is viewing a Report Summary in a Pending or Draft state, there is an Editar button.
* No edit button appears in the Closed or Published state. 
* Clicking "Editar" will reload the Report Summary in edit mode per the provided data discovery and wireframe. 
* For any MLB Players contained in the Report Summary, there is an "Editar Reporte" button available in edit mode. 
* Clicking "Editar Reporte" will open the modal. The appropriate fields display depending on which position is selected (see wires and data discovery). 
* Clicking "Cancelar" on the modal will cancel any edits made, close the modal and return the user to the Report Summary in edit mode. 
* The user has the ability to complete the modal and click "OK". 
* Clicking "OK" stores the edits made, closes the modal and returns the user to the Report Summary in edit mode. 
* Users are able to remove players from the Report in edit mode by using the trash can icon. 
* Users are able to add a player to the Report in edit mode by using the "Agregar Jugador" button.
* Clicking "Agregar Jugador" adds a row to the report summary, with the user able to pick a MLB Player (population of players is anyone currently on any MLB Org's MJ or MN Roster). 
* Once a player is selected, the Player field disables, the MLB Org populates and the "Editar Reporte" button becomes available for the player.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to save a Report Summary as a Draft
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=report_summary_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user is viewing a Report Summary in edit mode there is a Save button as well as a Cancel button. 
* Clicking '"Save" will save all changes made to the report, including added and removed players as well as any changes made to the individual players' report summaries. 
* Changes made to the individual players' report summaries are NOT saved in the system if the overall form is not saved after the edits are made. 
* If the report has never been saved before, then the system will update the status of the report to "Draft". 
* If the user clicks "Cancel" then the user will be prompted to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.
* If the user confirms, the screen will reload in view mode and none of the edits will be maintained.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see an accurate count of the players I still need to complete for a report
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=report_summary_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user is viewing a Report Summary, there is a MLB Players Info field at the top of the report. 
* The numbers displayed are the total number of players that the player report has been completed for, out of the total number of MLB players included in the report. (0 of 8 is 0 players completed out of the 8 required - there might be many more non-MLB players included in the report). 
* When the user completes an individual's player report, the first number should increment accordingly. 
* If a player is added to the report summary, the second number should increment accordingly. 
* If an MLB player is removed from the report summary, the second number should decrease accordingly. 
* Both of these numbers should increment on the fly as the user completes the report (should not require saving to update).
* This should work in both English and Spanish appropriately.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see errors if I attempt to close a Player modal without passing the required field/format check
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=inline_validation

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user clicks "OK" on the player modal on a Report Summary, the system should run a required field check for the fields displayed on the modal (varies based on the position selected). 
* If any of the required fields are left blank, the system should highlight those fields in red and display an inline error message stating the number of required fields missing. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "Count" is equal to or higher than each of the corresponding "Strike" amounts entered. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "High Speed" is equal to or higher than that entered for "Avg Speed"
* If either of the above rules are violated, the offending fields are highlighted in red, with the number of invalid values entered reflected in the in-line error message per the wireframe.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be able to Generate the Performance Report from the Club Communication widget
custom_expected:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user is viewing the Club Communication widget there is a "Generate Report" button. 
* Clicking the Generate Report button will launch the Business Objects prompt for the Winter League Performance Report. 
* The user should be able to use Business Objects to run the report according to their desired parameters. 
* Winter League Club users should ONLY be able to run the report for their own Club.

title: Winter League President Club Communication widget - Permissions
custom_expected:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+%28winterleagues.mlb.com%29+Roles+to+LDAP+Mapping

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Club Communications" tab in the Winter League Portal site. 
* There is a new LDAP created to control who can see the new League President Club Communication widget.
* This new LDAP needs to be added to the WLP League President role. 
* If the user has either WLP-WL-CLUB-COMMUNICATION-WIDGET-VIEWERS or the new League President widget viewer LDAP, then the Winter League Club users sees "Club Communication" tab, and it is the default landing page.
* If the user has neither of these, they do not see the Club Communication tab.

title: As a Winter League President User I want to view the Club Communication widget
custom_expected:
Wireframe: 
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=club_comm_widget_-_league_presidents

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Communication+Widget+-+Winter+League+President+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If the user has permission to view the Winter League President Club Communication widget, then clicking on the "Club Communication" tab will load the president's Club Communication widget per the provided wireframe and Data Discovery.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to publish a Report Summary
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=report_summary_-_wl_coach

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a winter league club user is viewing a Report Summary in the Draft status, there is a "Publish to Clubs" button displayed in either edit mode or view mode. 
* Clicking "Publish to Clubs" will update the Report Summary's status to Published. 
* In Spanish this is exactly the same except the button is "Publicar a los Equipos" and the status is updated to "Publicado".

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see an error if I attempt to publish a Report Summary with players incomplete (Spanish)
custom_expected:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking Publicar a los Equipos will check that there are no MLB players currently in the report that do not yet have the required fields completed in their individual summary. 
* If one or more players is found to be incomplete, a hard error is displayed. See Messages # 15.

title: As a user I want the system to automatically move Game Reports to Closed after 48 hours
custom_expected:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Each night the system should look to see if there are any report summaries still in a Preliminary or Draft status for a game that occurred more than 48 hours ago (need to use game time and NOT just game date for this). 
* If any report summaries are found, they should be moved to the "Closed" status.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see errors if I attempt to close a Player modal without passing the required field/format check (Spanish)
custom_expected:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=inline_validation

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Necessary+Spanish+Translations

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user clicks "OK" on the player modal on a Report Summary, the system should run a required field check for the fields displayed on the modal (varies based on the position selected). 
* If any of the required fields are left blank, the system should highlight those fields in red and display an inline error message stating the number of required fields missing. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "Count" is equal to or higher than each of the corresponding "Strike" amounts entered. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "High Speed" is equal to or higher than that entered for "Avg Speed"
* If either of the above rules are violated, the offending fields are highlighted in red, with the number of invalid values entered reflected in the in-line error message per the wireframe and provided translations.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be able to Generate the Performance Report from the Club Communication widget (Reporting Team) we
custom_expected:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Population%2C+Logic+and+Sort+Considerations

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Prompts

Audience/Security: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Performance+Report+-+Audience+-+Security+-+Frequency

View Story: #157500263

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking the Generate Report button will launch the Business Objects prompt for the Winter League Performance Report. 
* The user should be able to use Business Objects to run the report according to their desired parameters. 
* Winter League Club users should ONLY see their own reports returned when they run this report.

title: As a WLP user I want to see how many players have been completed on a game report from the widget
Temporary Mapping of winter league clubs to current MN Clubs for stats
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* In order to test the Club Communication portion of the system, we need to fake the stats of the clubs.
* Use the provided spreadsheet to map the WL Clubs to the MN Clubs for stats purposes. 

*Note that not every Club is mapped*

title: As a BOC user I want to see an are you sure message when Canceling a request
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Winter+League+Portal+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* When clicking 'Cancel' on the Requests page the user is prompted to confirm that they wish to cancel the player's request. See Messages #13.
* If the user confirms, the request is cancelled. 
* If the user does not confirm, no action is taken.

title: As a WLP user I want mobile friendly buttons when using the app on smaller screens
custom_steps:
**Mockup:**
See attached for how these look in EBIS

**AC:**
- On form pages within WLP mobile buttons should appear at the same screen size as EBIS (I believe we set it at screen sizes under 768px)
- The mobile button container should be pinned to the bottom of the screen, collapsed by default and display a blue arrow.
- Clicking the arrow will expand the mobile buttons and change the direction of the arrow. 
- Remove the MLB logo from the mobile button container currently displaying in WLP (screenshot attached)

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to type to filter the Requests page
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach

Acceptance Criteria:
* There is a search filter in the filters section of the screen. 
* Typing text in this search box filters the requests currently displayed on the screen. 


Came from https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-15581

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to be able to type to filter the Requests page
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=requests_-_wl_coach


Acceptance Criteria:
* There is a search filter in the filters section of the screen. 
* Typing text in this search box filters the requests currently displayed on the screen. 
* When viewing the page in Spanish it says "Buscar" instead of Search (grey hint text can remain in English).

Came from https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-15581

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to see errors if I attempt to close a Player modal without passing the required field/format check
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=inline_validation

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Report+Summary+-+Data+Discovery

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Player+Report+Modals+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League Club user clicks "OK" on the player modal on a Report Summary, the system should run a required field check for the fields displayed on the modal (varies based on the position selected). 
* If any of the required fields are left blank, the system should highlight those fields in red and display an inline error message stating the number of required fields missing. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "Count" is equal to or higher than each of the corresponding "Strike" amounts entered. 
* If the modal is for a pitcher, the system should also validate that the value entered for "High Speed" is equal to or higher than that entered for "Avg Speed"
* If either of the above rules are violated, the offending fields are highlighted in red, with the number of invalid values entered reflected in the in-line error message per the wireframe.

title: As a WLP user I want to be able to tell if a player's report summary has been completed by the color of the button
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When looking at a Report Summary, the "Edit Report" or "View Report" button is blue if the underlying report has been completed for the relevant player.
* This also works when viewing the form in Spanish.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to move a Winter League Request back to Pending from Canceled
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* When the BOC is viewing a Canceled Request in the WLP Requests screen, there is an option to move the Request back to Pending.
* The user will be able to successfully move the request to Pending. 
* From Pending, the user will be able to successfully move the request to Submitted and run through the workflow as though the request had never been canceled. 
* If the request was previously moved to canceled from a Submitted or In Negotiation state, a new Winter League Request transaction is created when the request is moved back to the Submitted state.

title: As a Winter League Club I want to be able to use Business Objects in Spanish
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* The prompts and Business Objects instance for the Winter League Performance Report in the Winter League Portal should display in Spanish if the report is accessed when the user is viewing the application in Spanish.
* It should continue to run/work in English if the report is accessed when the user is viewing the application in English.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to export the list of Winter League Requests for the current season
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* When a BOC user is viewing the Winter League Requests page, they see an Export button.
* Clicking Export downloads an Excel spreadsheet to the user's computer with a list of the current season's Winter League Requests, including all of the information that is visible to the BOC within the widget, including the entire content of any relevant comments.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reopen multiple report summaries at once
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a checkbox column added to the Club Communications widget for BOC users only.
* The BOC is able to check off one or more reports.
* There is a "Re-Open" button on the widget footer, and it is disabled until at least one report is checked off. 
* Clicking "Re-Open" will reopen the selected report(s). 
* If any reports are selected that are already in a Draft or Pending state, no action is taken.

title: As a WLP user I want Prior Season Import Requests to expire on a specific date
custom_steps:
Business Driver: 
* When a Winter League Request reaches the In Negotiation state, the BOC and the WL Team both see a countdown until the request expires. There is a new requirement that those requests that are a result of appearing as an Import player on a Reserve List expire based off of a system date rather than a set number of days*

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a new system date added "Prior Season Import Requests Expire".
* The Winter League Requests that are generated from an Import Request count down from this system date when they reach the In Negotiation status rather than the standard 11 days that all of the other In Negotiation requests use. 
* Non prior season import requests continue to use the 11 day countdown as described in the original story. #154102127 and #154101939
* Once the countdown reaches 0 for both prior season imports or regular winter league requests, the request status is updated to Expired. See #155384824

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to report a game not being listed (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=game_not_listed

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Game+Not+Listed+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League user is looking at the "Club Communication" widget in Spanish, they see a "Juegos No Listado" button. 
* Clicking on the button will open a popup, per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* When the user has entered the required fields, the "Reportar Juego Ausente" button is enabled. 
* Clicking this button will generate an email to ebissupport@mlb.com with the following information: 
 - Username of the user submitting the missing game.
 - Club affiliation of the user submitting the missing game. 
 - All of the information entered on the pop-up.
 - Date/time the missing game is being reported.
 - Environment the report is being sent from. 
* There should also be a "Cancelar" button available. Clicking Cancelar will close the modal without taking any action.

title: As a user I want to see all international first year signings in the bonus utility
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Users have requested that ALL first year international minor contracts appear in the signing bonus utility, instead of just the ones that include a signing bonus clause or mexican assignment agreement. 
* The Signing Bonus amount for any player that is included without any Signing Bonus clause or Mexican Assignment agreement would just be $0, and they would not show as an exception.

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to report a game not being listed
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=game_not_listed

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Game+Not+Listed+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Winter League user is looking at the "Club Communication" widget, they see a "Game Not Listed" button. 
* Clicking on the button will open a popup, per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* When the user has entered the required fields, the "Report Missing Game" button is enabled. 
* Clicking this button will generate an email to ebissupport@mlb.com with the following information: 
 - Username of the user submitting the missing game.
 - Club affiliation of the user submitting the missing game. 
 - All of the information entered on the pop-up.
 - Date/time the missing game is being reported.
 - Environment the report is being sent from. 
* There should also be a "Cancel" button available. Clicking Cancel will close the modal without taking any action. 
* The subject of the email should be "WLP - Missing Game Reported"

title: As a Winter League Club user I want to view the Player Report modal of a Report Summary for a pitcher (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://gox298.axshare.com/#p=pos___pitcher

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Player+Report+Modals+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Ver Informe" will appear on the Report Summary screen in view mode when viewing the site in Spanish for any Pitcher that has a completed report. 
* Clicking on "Ver Informe" will launch a modal in view mode in Spanish per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 

*Note that Box Score will be handled in a separate story*
